publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7568.1 Murdo Fraser: Removing the Barriers to Private Sector Investment in Superfast Broadband Infrastructure—As an amendment to motion (S3M-7568) in the name of Peter Peacock, leave out from "notes" to end and insert "welcomes BT’s intention, announced earlier this year, to offer pole and duct access in 2011 and further understands that allnext generation access (NGA) infrastructure deployed by BT is open to all NGA communications providers on an open wholesale access basis, providing consumers with more competitive prices and a choice of provider in Mid Scotland and Fife and the rest of Scotland; recognises that, while there are no plans to offer pole and duct access for existing copper-based networks, these networks are already open to all communications providers on an open wholesale access basis, and furtherwelcomes the UK Government’s commitment to take a mixed-technology approach to providing superfast broadband, with fixed, wireless and satellite all having a role, and that every community in the UK is to have access to superfast broadband by 2015."
